stimulusHtml: Which of the following best explains why the  Bugs  class does not compile?

features.html:
Consider the following  Bugs  class, which is intended to simulate variations in a population of bugs. The population is stored in the method’s  int  attribute. The  getPopulation  method is intended to allow methods in other classes to access a  Bugs  object’s population value. However, the class does not compile.

 

public class Bugs 
{ 
   private int population; 
    
   public Bugs(int p) 
   { 
      population = p; 
   } 
    
   public int getPopulation() 
   { 
      return p; 
   }
   
   /* There may be instance variables, constructors,
      and methods that are not shown. */
}

choicesHtml: The return type of the  getPopulation  method should be  void.
The  getPopulation  method should have at least one parameter.
The variable  population  is not declared inside the  getPopulation  method.
In the  getPopulation  method, the variable  population  should be returned instead of  p.
